data.title: Christmas movies that aren't TECHNICALLY Christmas movies - Topeka & Shawnee County Public Library
data.meta_description: Christmas movies that aren't TECHNICALLY Christmas movies by TSCPL_MichelleM - a staff-created list : There are movies that everyone watches this time of year that are straight-up holiday-Christmas flicks.  And then there are films one may not consider Christmas movies, but for some reason or another, they are synonymous the holidays.  Here's my starter list.
data.text:
*This one is almost a no-brainer* Christmas-y Factor: The entire movie kicks off with an office Christmas party, has a soundtrack that features Run D.M.C.'s 'Christmas in Hollis', and of course "Now I have a machine gun. Ho. Ho. Ho." *This one is almost a no-brainer* Christmas-y Factor: The entire movie kicks off with an office Christmas party, has a soundtrack that features Run D.M.C.'s 'Christmas in Hollis', and of course "Now I have a machine gun. Ho. Ho. Ho." Show less

This dark Christmastime tale is a Tim Burton flick that frequently gets raked over the coals. Christmas-y Factor: The Penguin's evil plan not only threate...Show more This dark Christmastime tale is a Tim Burton flick that frequently gets raked over the coals. Christmas-y Factor: The Penguin's evil plan not only threatens the children of Gotham, but Christmas itself! Not to mention an Ice Princess, soldier penguins and don't even think of forgetting the Gotham City Tree Lighting Ceremony. "Mistletoe can be deadly if you eat it." Show less

Diane Keaton as the head of family of 6 and a snowy New England setting are key players in my personal favorite on this list. Christmas-y Factor: All exc...Show more Diane Keaton as the head of family of 6 and a snowy New England setting are key players in my personal favorite on this list. Christmas-y Factor: All excellent Christmas films have some sort of bully or bad guy, here perfectly played by Rachel McAdams. The anti-hero with a secret heart of gold. Oh, also the entire story takes place in the family home while everyone is in town celebrating Christmas. There is so much heart in this movie. Actually, I'm gonna take a break and go re-watch it real quick! BRB. "You have a freak flag. You just don't fly it." Show less

This movie is a film noir disguised as a Christmas movie, disguised as a film noir. If you don't mind a film set during the holidays that's chock full of...Show more This movie is a film noir disguised as a Christmas movie, disguised as a film noir. If you don't mind a film set during the holidays that's chock full of foul language, this this is a must see. Christmas-y Factor: Movie opens at a Christmas party, Robert Downey Jr. robs a toy store to get the #1 gifts off his childs Christmas wish list and sexy Santa suits. "Go. Sleep badly. Any questions, hesitate to call." Show less

Christmas-y Factor: The whole movies is a story about why it snows on Christmas! Also, Edward shaving ice sculptures and making it 'snow' for Kim....mag...Show more Christmas-y Factor: The whole movies is a story about why it snows on Christmas! Also, Edward shaving ice sculptures and making it 'snow' for Kim....magical. "I know it is a little early for Christmas, Edward, but; I have a present for you." Show less

Christmas-y Factor: Lots of sweaters and sweater weather, two people adorably failing to carry a Christmas tree and, of course, that New Year's Eve speech. "I'll have what she's having." Christmas-y Factor: Lots of sweaters and sweater weather, two people adorably failing to carry a Christmas tree and, of course, that New Year's Eve speech. "I'll have what she's having." Show less

Not just the first movie, but the entire franchise. Christmas-y Factor: Virtually every movie we get to enjoy a Christmas at Hogwarts...and it's GLORIOUS...Show more Not just the first movie, but the entire franchise. Christmas-y Factor: Virtually every movie we get to enjoy a Christmas at Hogwarts...and it's GLORIOUS. Not to mention there is often a marathon happening on multiple channels. "Happy Christmas." Show less

As terrifying as I found this flick as a child, this is definetly one of Christmas' 'midnight movies.' Christmas-y Factor: Gizmo was a Christmas gift fro...Show more As terrifying as I found this flick as a child, this is definetly one of Christmas' 'midnight movies.' Christmas-y Factor: Gizmo was a Christmas gift from father to son, and there are gremlins 'singing' Christmas carols. "Now I have another reason to hate Christmas." Show less

All copies in use Availability details Holds: 1 on 1 copy

Christmas-y Factor: Christmas holiday house swap, snowy winter in England, and enough warm fuzzies we can easily look past two couples who are brought to...Show more Christmas-y Factor: Christmas holiday house swap, snowy winter in England, and enough warm fuzzies we can easily look past two couples who are brought together in less than two weeks time, and everyone skiping off on cross-continental travel during Christmas week! ;) "Iris, if you were a melody...I used only the good notes." Show less
